ygData.messageBody:
Thx for the info. Say now I'm at lvl 20 and just started to train in
speciallization of evoke. As a start I think I'm already at skill lvl 20.
If I start in town and cast evoke spell on myself, med, cast etc, can the
specialization in evoke skill rise to 50? Eg, when I get med skill at lvl
4, the lvl ceiling when I'm at lvl 4 is (4+1)x5=25 and not 5. What I'm
trying to ask is tat, certain skill we need certain lvl to START training,
but the lvl ceiling is just like other magery skills, which is (lvl+1)x5
right?


On Thursday, 15 July, 1999 3:22 PM, Leshrec [SMTP:leshrec@...]
wrote:
> From: "Leshrec" <leshrec@...>
>
> 1. No need the books if you can find the recipies on the internet. But I
> think its more fun to get the books and mastering the languages. This IS
a
> roleplaying game after all =)
> 2. You need a lexicon. Its like a container where you dump your stuff
into
> it and click on research. I bought mine from wiz guild in Felwithe but I
> think FP mage guild sells it too. It was at 10pp when i bought it so FP
> might be a little more.
> 3. To specialize in evocation, you need to keep casting evocation spells.
> This is the IMPORTANT part, if your abjuration or some other spell
schools
> get to 50, The game will not warn you that yer gonna specialize in it.
Once
> its 51, Its considered as your specialize skill and the rest can't go
above
> 50 already, so better keep an eye out for it especially if you wanna
> specialize in evoc. btw, the specialize skill and the normal spell skill
is
> different skills alttogether. They will say something like " You are
better
> at specialize:Evocation (78)!" instead of just evocation.
> Hope that helps =)
>
> Leshrec Kalesk'Thor High Elven Wizard of the Sixth Circle
